title: Auto/Retro/Frigidaire type of connecting script...
content:
I'm looking for scripts similar to this: Frigidaire

That connected, automobile/retro type of thing. Any suggestions?

Thanks,

Kyle
author: Hildebrant

comments.content:
Permanent Waves from Font Diner is one.

[http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_doggie.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010224542/http:/www.fontdiner.com/menu_doggie.html "http://www.fontdiner.com/menu\_doggie.html")
Leslie Cabarga's [Magneto](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010224542/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Magneto) comes to mind, although it is a bit thicker than the Frigidaire example.

Oh, and there are also two more by Leslie Cabarga, [Raceway](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010224542/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/raceway/) and [Streamline](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010224542/http:/www/).

Rocket Script from Font Diner too

[http://www.fontdiner.com/main.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010224542/http:/www.fontdiner.com/main.html "http://www.fontdiner.com/main.html")

under "Free Silverware"
Here's the link for [Atomatic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010224542/http:/www.linotype.com/966/linotypeatomatic-family.html); I can't get Stephen's to work.
A little late to the game, but there is also [Belair](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010224542/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=WIFO-BERE) from Wilton.
